title.narrative: SSC in the Energy sector between DK and Ethiopia phase I

description.narrative:
The Strategic Sector Cooperation on Energy aims to improving the framework conditions of the Ethiopian energy sector in general and improve a sustainable planning of energy consumption by:
-Improving national planning of energy consumption and supply -Improving of national regulatory frameworks for energy management -Developing an advisory support (platform) to stakeholders and mandated bodies on management of energy

The Strategic Sector Cooperation on Energy is a peer-to-peer cooperation between the Danish Energy Agency and the Ethiopian Ministry Water, Irrigation and Energy. Through the cooperation, the Ethiopian ministry will improve national planning of energy consumption and supply, improve national regulatory frameworks for energy management and gain tools to support transparent and knowledge based decision-making.
A Strategic Sector Cooperation (SSC) is a partnership aiming at improving sector framework conditions in a partner country. The initiative is a flexible and adaptive instrument for exchanging experiences, learning and capacity building, which builds on a consolidated strong relationship and trust between the involved authorities. The commitment to finance the Danish authorities’ participation is sequenced in phases; an inception phase of approximately one year resulting in a project document; followed by phase one, two and –if need be – a phase three during which the cooperation is deepened and developed. All SSC partnerships are supported by a sector advisor at the embassy, who impel progress and stir the partnership in the direction agreed upon.
Annually, the SSC projects deliver a report on project progress and results achieved. Progress on selected outputs are displayed in openaid.
